New York University Abu Dhabi Library
Hisham Khatib Collection
Khatib, Hisham, Mr.
AD.MC.030
2,944 Photographic Prints - 783 prints, 1,427 postcards (including within 7 postcard albums), 16 photograph albums (734 pages total)
1880s - 1920s The Hisham Khatib Collection on the Holy Land and region is one of the largest collections of Middle Eastern photography still in private hands. It contains hundreds of 19th century original albumen photographic prints as well as many travel albums of the same period and early 20th century with hundreds of black and white photographs and postcards. The collection contains photography from dozens of photographers, but the albumen prints are mostly the work of the Bonfils family, Francis Frith, Francis Bedford, Matson photo Service, American Colony, Zangaki Brothers, and Frank Mason Good.
Dr. Hisham Khatib has spent over 40 years amassing a vast and historically valuable collection of representations of the Near East, including the Holy Lands, including Palestine, Jordan, Turkey, Syria and Egypt. The artworks in this extraordinary collection include paintings, prints, maps, books, photographs, as well as postcards. A large part of Dr. Khatib's collection consists of rare photographic prints: he has over 3,000 images. Digital surrogates only - physical objects not deposited
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Collection obtained directly from Dr. Hisham Khatib and digitized by Akkasah in Amman, Jordan in 2017.
Arrangement
Collection was digitized as access was given and arranged according to box and album from Dr. Hisham Khatib's private collection.
Biographical / Historical
The Hisham Khatib Collection on the Holy Land and region is one of the largest collections of Middle Eastern photography still in private hands. It contains thousands of 19th century original albumen photographic prints as well as many travel albums of the same period and early 20th century with hundreds of black and white photographs and postcards. The collection contains photography from dozens of photographers, but the albumen prints are mostly the work of the Bonfils family, Francis Frith, Francis Bedford, Underwood and Underwood Co., Photoglob of Zurich, Mendel John Diness, The Vester & Co. – American Colony, Khalil Ra'ad, Peter Bergheim, Zangaki Brothers, and Frank Mason Good.
Dr. Hisham Khatib has spent over 40 years amassing a vast and historically valuable collection of representations of the Near East, including the Holy Lands, including Palestine, Jordan, Turkey, Syria and Egypt. The artworks in this extraordinary collection include paintings, prints, maps, books, photographs, as well as postcards. A large part of Dr. Khatib's collection consists of rare photographic prints: he has over 6000 images, 3000 of which are in albums.
Conditions Governing Use
Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by Dr. Hisham Khatib are maintained by New York University. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from repository. Please contact Akkasah at akkasah@nyu.edu
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Hisham Khatib Collection; AD_MC_030; box number; folder number or item identifier; Akkasah Center for Photography, New York University.
